title.narrative: Provision of Nutrition services for Moderately Acute malnourished children and malnourished PLW in Balochistan

description.narrative: The main objective of this project is to provide safe, lifesaving nutrition services for treatment to Moderate Acute Malnutrition (MAM) children and Pregnant and Lactating Women (PLWs) at health facilities and communities. This WFP project establishes and operationalizes 38 supplementary feeding services, supplies specialized nutritious food, and builds the capacity of of mother to mother and father support groups among other activities. The project provides life-saving assistance to 41,222 people, including over 15,000 women and over 25,000 children, including more that 5,000 people with disabilities.

owner-org.narrative: UN OCHA Central Emergency Response Fund (CERF)

organisation.narrative: UN Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (OCHA)

mailing-address.narrative: United Nations Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (OCHA), Central Emergency Response Fund (CERF), 2 United Nations Plaza (DC2), East 44th street (13th floor), United Nations, New York, USA

description.narrative: Disbursement to CERF Project Provision of Nutrition services for Moderately Acute malnourished children and malnourished PLW in Balochistan

title.narrative: RESIDENT / HUMANITARIAN COORDINATOR REPORT ON THE USE OF CERF FUNDS PAKISTAN UNDERFUNDED EMERGENCIES MULTIPLE EMERGENCIES 2020

condition.narrative: CERF funding is based on an agreed proposal, including specific planned outcomes and outputs.

description.narrative: Children from 6 to 59 months screened, identified, registered and treated for MAM in the targeted area of 29 Union Council

# Specialized Nutritious Food procured and distributed in timely manner amongst the targeted MAM children age 06 to 59 months and pregnant & lactating women (PLW) in the targeted areas(AchaMum: 232Metric tons and Mamta:279 Metric tons)
# of Trainings/refresher and other formal orientations for existing health and CSO staff to implement CMAM, MIYCN, Covid-19 safety measures will be organized for quality implementation
# of integrated static and mobile treatment sites established in the targeted areas.

# of moderately acute malnourished girls and boys and pregnant/lactating women accessing specialized ready to use supplementary food/ Achamum (RUSF) and Mamta from WFP supported Targeted supplementary feeding program

Mothers/caretakers in targeted communities’ access skilled support for appropriate maternal, infant and young child nutrition (MIYCN) practices, with emphasis on promotion of breastfeeding, complementary feeding, and awareness of safety measures on COVID-19.
# of mothers/caretakers of girls and boys counselled on optimal MIYCN practices
# of mothers/caretakers, health workers will be counselled on IPC and COVID-19 prevention.
# of nutrition sites providing skilled support for promotion of appropriate MIYCN practices and Covid-19 safety measures.
